channel.title: Another one of those tough riddles
channel.description:
I have seen people posting riddles but this one is the hardest I think. And it's not as easy as it sounds. Have fun :)
Riddle: If the man had seen the saw dust, he wouldn't have died.
Answer: The man died because he killed himself. He did it because he held a record for the shortest man in the world. A man cut his cain but because he was blind he thought he grew so he had no reason to live.
Hints:
1.He was blind (this is almost 1/2 the answer) 2.He had a cain. 3.He had a record for being the worlds shortest man (basicly the other 1/4) 4.He committed suicide 5.He was miss led

item.title: Another one of those tough riddles
item.dc:creator: @ninjasod ninjasod
item.description:
@ninjasod wrote:

Since the man was poor he had to live in an alley, and alleys are full of rats. Rats = bye bye cheese. The man had a poor education, thats why hes poor, so he couldnt realize that the rats were eating his cheese. Everytime he went back to the same alley with cheese, the rats ate it. He went days without eating, and eventually died.

But wouldnt he die of dehydration first?

Read full topic
item.source: Another one of those tough riddles

item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

Ok, here’s one.

A poor man died of starvation even though he took cheese with him, where ever he went.

item.title: Another one of those tough riddles
item.dc:creator: @ninjasod ninjasod
item.description:
@ninjasod wrote:

[quote=“Rum0, post:34, topic:95684”]The man, who was blind, made his living in the circus as a midget clown. Termites have been eating the end of his cane causing the sawdust. Because he could not see the cane has become shorter, when he had to reach down farther than usual to touch the ground with is, he thought he was growing. Thinking this would result in losing his job, he became despondent and shot himself.

Blah

Owned[/quote][quote=“Haxor62, post:36, topic:95684”]You all were wrong to many answers similar.
Answer: The man died because he killed himself. He did it because he held a record for the shortest man in the world. A man cut his cain but because he was blind he thought he grew so he had no reason to live.

Don’t say it’s impossible because people have gotten it.[/quote]

That’s pretty much the same thing, except instead of a job it was a record…

Read full topic
item.source: Another one of those tough riddles

item.title: Another one of those tough riddles
item.dc:creator: @MybJames MybJames
item.description:
@MybJames wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:2, topic:96109”][quote author=MybJames link=topic=138211.msg1334631#msg1334631 date=1179491231]

i believe that this is not a riddle, but a random statement.

A riddle is a puzzle, consisting of text with a question to answer.

i see no question.

tbh

“If the man had seen the saw dust, he wouldn’t have died. How did he die?”
[/quote]
“a man died; how did he die?”
how would you answer that? that is exactly what he is asking[/quote]
Well it does give a vague clue.

Read full topic

item.title: Another one of those tough riddles
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

[quote=“nator123123, post:355, topic:69145”]Now for nicodk, and for some sense for everyone:
There are many meanings to operate. Riddles, just need common sense. To operate. The doctor cannot operate his son, because he is injured. The doctor cannot operate his son, because he is dead. The doctor cannot operate his son, because he is too lazy. The doctor cannot operate his son, because it wasn’t his son. The doctor cannot operate his son, because the head doctor can only operate on certain spots, such as the head. Riddles are made for challenging the brain, therefor it can have millions, and millions of answers. You can bring that to the common riddle, ‘Why did the chicken cross the road?’. There is billions, maybe even googles of answers. Riddles are to tease the brain, in my thought, it makes the teller of the riddle feel good, as for he can make millions of answers for the riddle, and his pray has chances and chances, and if the teller is not the good riddle-teller kind, he can switch the answer over and over again. Riddles are just for fun, and they should stay that way.

You may not understand much or anything I have said, because everything you think of at first turns into a ‘maybe’ or an ‘about’.
Also because maybe you are not understanding which type I’m using.
ex for ‘The doctor cannot operate his son, because he is injured’.
As I have told you, there are many meanings to operate, and in that current sentence I’m using the ‘Operating the boy’ as in ‘Operating the machine’.
It can be hard to understand things.

Then on, Riddles Rock![/quote]
…

Read full topic
item.source: Another one of those tough riddles

item.title: Another one of those tough riddles
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:18, topic:95684”][quote author=alex4ever link=topic=138211.msg1333637#msg1333637 date=1179468839]

Wait, if he’s the world’s shortest man, he fell into a sandbox, and the cane flew right into his rectum, disturbing his hemorrhoids, causing never-ending rectal bleeding ultimately leading to his death.
[/quote]wow how LONG did it take you to come up with that???

3 minutes, 34 seconds, 238 milliseconds, and 3442 nanoseconds, why?[/quote]cos you forgot to say the cause of the never ending bleeding was because he was a hemophiliac

l2riddle, riddles are questions, not stupid statements

Read full topic
